metadata.Title: CVE-2020-35681 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium
metadata.Description:
Django Channels 3.x before 3.0.3 allows remote attackers to obtainsensitive information from a different request scope. The legacychannels.http.AsgiHandler class, used for handling HTTP type requests in anASGI environment prior to Django 3.0, did not correctly separate requestscopes in Channels 3.0. In many cases this would result in a crash but,with correct timing, responses could be sent to the wrong client, resultingin potential leakage of session identifiers and other sensitive data. Notethat this affects only the legacy Channels provided class, and not Django'ssimilar ASGIHandler, available from Django 3.0.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-35681` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

python3-django-channels - 3.0.3-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: python-django-channels package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.0.3-1').
